abstract: The nation’s largest cable provider will have access to Disney networks, including the Disney Channel and ESPN, in a deal that is worth hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue for the entertainment company.
snippet: The nation’s largest cable provider will have access to Disney networks, including the Disney Channel and ESPN, in a deal that is worth hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue for the entertainment company.
lead_paragraph: 1/5/12 | Updated In a deal that represents billions of dollars in revenue for the Walt Disney Company, the entertainment giant and Comcast said Wednesday that they had reached a decade-long distribution agreement covering all of Disney’s television content, including streaming for iPads and other devices.

headline.main: Comcast’s 10-Year Deal With Disney Includes Out-of-Home Viewing

byline.original: By Amy Chozick and Brooks Barnes
